titleStmt.title: The schoole of abuse conteining a plesaunt [sic] inuectiue against poets, pipers, plaiers, iesters, and such like caterpillers of a co[m]monwelth; setting vp the hagge of defiance to their mischieuous exercise, [and] ouerthrowing their bulwarkes, by prophane writers, naturall reason, and common experience: a discourse as pleasaunt for gentlemen that fauour learning, as profitable for all that wyll follow virtue. By Stephan Gosson. Stud. Oxon.
titleStmt.author: Gosson, Stephen, 1554-1624.

notesStmt.note: Printed by T. Dawson. Cf. STC.
This edition has title page with initials "T D" in the border; B3r, line 1 ends: 'that'.
Reproductions of originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery and Emmanuel College Library, Cambridge University.
